definition: (of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: I just escaped from the water and all my belongings were swept away.
sentences.chinese: 我剛從水裏逃出來，所有的財產全沖走了。

sentences.english: The swollen river washed away the footbridge.
sentences.chinese: 氾濫的河水沖走了人行橋。

sentences.english: Officials say some 200 people have been flown out of the village of Hsiaolin, in Taiwan's Kaohsiung county.
sentences.chinese: 有官員稱，臺灣高雄市小林村沖走了約200人。

sentences.english: Some swept away after clinging to rooftops.
sentences.chinese: 許多在屋頂避難的人被沖走。

sentences.english: An arch of the bridge in the park has been sapped and sopped away.
sentences.chinese: 獵園裏的那座橋有一個橋洞被水沖毀，而且被沖走了。

sentences.english: Han kept comforting her sister whose house was also buried.
sentences.chinese: 韓女士安慰房子也被沖走了的妹妹。

sentences.english: The footbridge washed away during the floods.
sentences.chinese: 人行橋在水災中沖走了。

sentences.english: When it rained, the soil washed away, down the hills and into the rivers.
sentences.chinese: 當下雨的時辰，泥土被沖走，從贍上滑下進進河內。

sentences.english: The bridge was washed away by the swollen river.
sentences.chinese: 橋給上漲的河水沖走了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of houses have been washed away by floods.
sentences.chinese: 數百間房屋被洪水沖走了。

sentences.english: The offspring of his house shall be exposed, he shall be pulled down in the day of God's wrath.
sentences.chinese: 洪水沖走他的住宅，在天主義怒之日要全被衝去。

sentences.english: After curing, the surface was washed and a clear sealer applied.
sentences.chinese: 固化後，表面被沖走和清晰的密封應用。

sentences.english: A heavy deluge in1957again washed everything away.
sentences.chinese: 1957年一陳暴雨又把什麼都沖走了。

sentences.english: We embankment to resist the sea, yet the sea are washed away.
sentences.chinese: 我們築堤抵擋大海，大海卻把它們沖走。

sentences.english: Nearly all the plants had been washed out of the grave.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的花苗都被沖走了。

sentences.english: When all the top-soil is gone, nothing remains but worthless desert.
sentences.chinese: 上層泥土沖走後就只留下貧瘠的沙漠。

definition: to have water get in (one's ear, shoes etc)/to get flooded/inflow of water
to collect water/to be covered with water/to pond/accumulated water/ponding
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
